summary: "Computer assisted publishing" refers to the integration of information technology in the publishing process, enhancing efficiency and accuracy in document creation and dissemination. Within the EU legal and regulatory framework, this concept is pivotal for ensuring compliance with data protection regulations, such as the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). By utilizing advanced data processing techniques, computer assisted publishing facilitates the management of large volumes of legal texts, ensuring that information is accessible and up-to-date. This innovation supports transparency and accountability in EU institutions, promoting effective communication of regulatory changes and legal standards across member states.
